title: MacBook Air a1237 Boot "Loop"
message:
Hi everyone, i hope it is not a problem to post a software level question here.

this macbook air keeps restarting with a white screen and a window with the error " You shut down your computer because of a problem". This mac was formated a couple of months ago because it remained on the apple logo on startup every time and it worked fine till now.
Now it boots fine on secure mode but not on the normal mode. What should i do?

forgot to say, the customer said that before doing this the machine became extremel slow and often unresponsive. the hard disk  has already been changed. i Suspect some sensor

title: MacBook Air a1237 Boot "Loop"
message: No, no, just do not even attempt to fix this ancient pile of shit. Stay away from these!

title: MacBook Air a1237 Boot "Loop"
message:
[QUOTE="Nick, post: 16085"]Now it boots fine on secure mode but not on the normal mode. What should i do?[/QUOTE]

Throw it in the trash.

title: MacBook Air a1237 Boot "Loop"
message: Duke and Jason saying to trash something. I wish I could show this to the customer. Ok guys, on to the next one

title: MacBook Air a1237 Boot "Loop"
message: This machine is absolute garbage and should have never been released.
